bug.summary: Bugs in the progress bar output.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Issue description</denchmark-h>
There are certain bugs in the progress bar callback output which needs attention. <denchmark-h:h4>Your environment</denchmark-h>
version of ensmallen: 2.11.4 operating system: Ubuntu 18.04 compiler: gcc 7.4.0 version of Armadillo: 9.800.3
<denchmark-h:h4>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
I ran a mlpack ffn model for three epochs with the progress bar callback incorporated on a dummy dataset the output I got was, <denchmark-code>Epoch 1/192 1875/1875 [====================================================================================================] 100% - 42s 54ms/step - loss: 208.982 Epoch 2/192 1875/1875 [====================================================================================================] 100% - 44s 55ms/step - loss: 1.47048 Epoch 3/192 1875/1875 [====================================================================================================] 100% - 38s 52ms/step - loss: 0.523849 </denchmark-code>
And when I the same model with MaxIterations() parameter of the optimizer set to 0 i.e. with no limits on the number of epochs the output I got was, <denchmark-code>Epoch 1/0 1875/1875 [====================================================================================================] 100% - 37s 52ms/step - loss: 208.982 Epoch 2/0 1875/1875 [====================================================================================================] 100% - 43s 55ms/step - loss: 1.47048 </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
With three epochs the expected epoch counter should be shown as 1/3, 2/3 and 3/3 and not 1/192, 2/192, 3/192
With no limit on the number of epochs, the epoch counter should be shown, in my opinion, as 1/(no limit), 2/(no limit) and so on to be more intuitive.
Also, the ETA value shouldn't be stuck on 0 when the epoch is executing.
<denchmark-h:h4>Actual behavior</denchmark-h>
From the output which has been pasted above it can be seen that there are bugs in the output which needs attention. Thank you
